Data report the crystal structure of E. coli CFA synthase. The enzyme is a dimer in the crystal and in solution, with each subunit containing a smaller N-domain that associates tightly with a larger catalytic C-domain, even following cleavage of the inter-domain linker or co-expression of each individual domain.
